pylapp.smoothclicker.android.tools.screen

Class WakelockManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.tools.screen.WakelockManager

  • public class WakelockManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which manages a wakelock to prevent the device to go to sleep and have its screen off. Base on a singleton design pattern. Use:
    Since:
    30/05/2016
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    pylapp

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static WakelockManager instance
      The singleton
      static java.lang.String LOCK_TAG
      The tag associated to the wake lock in use
      private static java.lang.String LOG_TAG 
      private Context mContext
      The context in use to retrieve the system service to get the PowerManager
      private PowerManager.WakeLock mWakeLock
      The wakelock in use
      private static int WAKE_LOCK_TYPE
      The wakelock to use: this ensure the screen is on at full brightness, the keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private WakelockManager()
      Default constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acquireWakelock()
      Acquire a wakelock.
      void clear()
      Clears the singleton be deleting all its variables (context and wakelocks)
      boolean isWakeLockAcquired()
      Returns if a wakelock has been acquired / defined
      void refreshContext(Context c)
      Refreshes the context used to get the PowerManager and the wake lock
      void releaseWakelock()
      Releases the held wake lock and nullify it
      void switchWakelockState()
      Switches the state of the wakelock.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        The context in use to retrieve the system service to get the PowerManager

        The singleton

      • WAKE_LOCK_TYPE

        private static final int WAKE_LOCK_TYPE
        The wakelock to use: this ensure the screen is on at full brightness, the keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off

        The tag associated to the wake lock in use

    • Method Detail

      • refreshContext

        public void refreshContext(Context c)
        Refreshes the context used to get the PowerManager and the wake lock
        Parameters:
        c - - The new context to use, must be defined

      • isWakeLockAcquired

        public boolean isWakeLockAcquired()
        Returns if a wakelock has been acquired / defined
        Returns:
        boolean - True if wakelock acquired, false otherwise

      • acquireWakelock

        public void acquireWakelock()
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Acquire a wakelock. If the lock was null, creates a new one and acquired it. If it was not null and held, release it and create a new one. If it was not null and not held, creates a new one
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - If no context has been defined

      • releaseWakelock

        public void releaseWakelock()
        Releases the held wake lock and nullify it

      • switchWakelockState

        public void switchWakelockState()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Switches the state of the wakelock. If a wakelock exists: it will be released (if needed) and nullified. If a wakelock does not exist: it will be created and acquired
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - If no context has been defined

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the singleton be deleting all its variables (context and wakelocks)
